intro: Apinagia itanensis, commonly known as the Itanés bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branched. Apinagia itanensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators.
